details: Working with Dr. Liu's group to automatically diagnose Retinopathy of Prematurity (potentially blinding disease common to premature infants) using deep learning
Classifying disease stage by combining object detection and convolutional neural networks
Proposing a novel method by first highlighting the symptomatic ridges using object detection before feeding the highlighted image into a classifier

Evaluating the convenience, scalability, and robustness of UPC++, a parallel distributed partitioned global address space library, by testing common parallel graph algorithms implemented using library and OpenMP, a common shared-memory parallel library
Ran experiments on AWS Clusters and Multi-Processor machines
Presenting at MIT for the PRIMES conference
Paper in progress. Presentation slides, abstract, and paper will be available soon
Created an energy/memory-efficient model to classify vegetable and fruit images using MobileNet and transfer learning in TensorFlow

Worked with my team to create Amazon Alexa plugins that support music, user identity, and mood (by voice/image) mood recognition, as well as a home-made Google image search functionality, using convolutional neural networks and NLP
Trained an undefeated Connect-4 AI based on the AlphaGo paper
Created a program to track finger movement with a camera to process handwriting input
Implemented a web interface (with a physics engine) to design and simulate causality tests using Box2D and JS
Collected and processed experiment data with a SQL database
Translated Ruby scripts processing DNA information into Python
Created a mobile AR Nutrition Scanner displaying human-readable nutrition facts using 3D animations using Unity
Acclimated smart lightbulbs to automatically turn on and off during specific times of the day based on learned usage patterns in Golang
